func dumpMethodSet(i interface{}) {
    dynTyp := reflect.TypeOf(i)

    if dynTyp == nil {
        fmt.Printf("there is no dynamic type\n")
        return
    }

    n := dynTyp.NumMethod()
    if n == 0 {
        fmt.Printf("%s's method set is empty!\n", dynTyp)
        return
    }

    fmt.Printf("%s's method set:\n", dynTyp)
    for j := 0; j < n; j++ {
        fmt.Println("-", dynTyp.Method(j).Name)
    }
    fmt.Printf("\n")
}

# go version: 1.16.5
func dumpMethodSet(i interface{}) {
dynTyp := reflect.TypeOf(i)

if dynTyp == nil {
fmt.Printf("there is no dynamic type ")
return
}

n := dynTyp.NumMethod()
if n == 0 {
fmt.Printf("%s's method set is empty! ", dynTyp)
return
}

fmt.Printf("%s's method set: ", dynTyp)
for j := 0; j < n; j++ {
fmt.Println("-", dynTyp.Method(j).Name)
}
fmt.Printf(" ")
}

type T struct{}

func (T) M1() {}
func (T) M2() {}

func (*T) M3() {}
func (*T) M4() {}

func main() {
var n int
dumpMethodSet(n)
dumpMethodSet(&n)

var t T
dumpMethodSet(t)
dumpMethodSet(&t)
}

main()
